intro: Scuticaria strictifolia, commonly known as the rigid-leaved scuticaria, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its upright, stiff stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Scuticaria strictifolia is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
